verses.text: And David fled from Naioth in Ramah, and came and said before Jonathan, What have I done? what \add is\add* mine iniquity? and what \add is\add* my sin before thy father, that he seeketh my life?

And he said unto him, God forbid; thou shalt not die: behold, my father will do nothing \add either\add* great or small, but that he will shew it me: and why should my father hide this thing from me? it \add is\add* not \add so\add*.

And David sware moreover, and said, Thy father certainly knoweth that I have found grace in thine eyes; and he saith, Let not Jonathan know this, lest he be grieved: but truly \add as\add* the \sc Lord\sc* liveth, and \add as\add* thy soul liveth, \add there is\add* but a step between me and death.
Then said Jonathan unto David, Whatsoever thy soul desireth, I will even do \add it\add* for thee.

And David said unto Jonathan, Behold, to morrow \add is\add* the new moon, and I should not fail to sit with the king at meat: but let me go, that I may hide myself in the fields unto the third \add day\add* at even.

If thy father at all miss me, then say, David earnestly asked \add leave\add* of me that \add he\add* might run \add to\add* Beth-lehem his city: for \add there is\add* a yearly sacrifice there for all the family.
If he say thus, \add It is\add* well; thy servant shall have peace: but if he be very wroth, \add then\add* be sure that evil is determined by him.

Therefore thou shalt deal kindly with thy servant; for thou hast brought thy servant into a covenant of the \sc Lord\sc* with thee: notwithstanding, if there be in me iniquity, slay me thyself; for why shouldest thou bring me to thy father?
And Jonathan said, Far be it from thee: for if I knew certainly that evil were determined by my father to come upon thee, then would not I tell it thee?
Then said David to Jonathan, Who shall tell me? or what \add if\add* thy father answer thee roughly?
And Jonathan said unto David, Come, and let us go out \add into\add* the field. And they went out both of them \add into\add* the field.

And Jonathan said unto David, O \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel, when I have sounded my father about to morrow \add any\add* time, \add or\add* the third \add day\add*, and behold, \add if there be\add* good toward David, and I then send not unto thee, and shew it thee;

the \sc Lord\sc* do so and much more to Jonathan: \add but\add* if it please my father \add to do\add* thee evil, then I will shew it thee, and send thee away, that thou mayest go in peace: and the \sc Lord\sc* be with thee, as he hath been with my father.
And thou shalt not only while yet I live shew me the kindness of the \sc Lord\sc*, that I die not:
but \add also\add* thou shalt not cut off thy kindness from my house for ever: no, not when the \sc Lord\sc* hath cut off the enemies of David every one from the face of the earth.
So Jonathan made \add a covenant\add* with the house of David, \add saying\add*, Let the \sc Lord\sc* even require \add it\add* at the hand of David’s enemies.
And Jonathan caused David to swear again, because he loved him: for he loved him as he loved his own soul.
Then Jonathan said to \add David\add*, To morrow \add is\add* the new moon: and thou shalt be missed, because thy seat will be empty.

And \add when\add* thou hast stayed three days, \add then\add* thou shalt go down quickly, and come to the place where thou didst hide thyself when the business was \add in hand\add*, and shalt remain by the stone Ezel.
And I will shoot three arrows on the side \add thereof\add*, as \add though\add* I shot at a mark.

And behold, I will send a lad, \add saying\add*, Go, find out the arrows. If I expressly say unto the lad, Behold, the arrows \add are\add* on this side of thee, take them; then come thou: for \add there is\add* peace to thee, and no hurt; \add as\add* the \sc Lord\sc* liveth.
But if I say thus unto the young man, Behold, the arrows \add are\add* beyond thee; go \add thy way:\add* for the \sc Lord\sc* hath sent thee away.
And \add as touching\add* the matter which thou and I have spoken of, behold, the \sc Lord\sc* \add be\add* between thee and me for ever.
So David hid himself in the field: and when the new moon was come, the king sat him down to eat meat.
And the king sat upon his seat, as at other times, \add even\add* upon a seat by the wall: and Jonathan arose, and Abner sat by Saul’s side, and David’s place was empty.
Nevertheless Saul spake not any thing that day: for he thought, Something hath befallen him, he \add is\add* not clean; surely \add he is\add* not clean.

And it came to pass on the morrow, \add which was\add* the second \add day\add* of the month, that David’s place was empty: and Saul said unto Jonathan his son, Wherefore cometh not the son of Jesse to meat, neither yesterday, nor to day?
And Jonathan answered Saul, David earnestly asked \add leave\add* of me \add to go\add* to Beth-lehem:

and he said, Let me go, I pray thee; for our family hath a sacrifice in the city; and my brother, he hath commanded me \add to be there:\add* and now, if I have found favour in thine eyes, let me get away, I pray thee, and see my brethren. Therefore he cometh not unto the king’s table.

Then Saul’s anger was kindled against Jonathan, and he said unto him, Thou son of the perverse rebellious \add woman\add*, do not I know that thou hast chosen the son of Jesse to thine own confusion, and unto the confusion of thy mother’s nakedness?
For as long as the son of Jesse liveth upon the ground, thou shalt not be stablished, nor thy kingdom. Wherefore now send and fetch him unto me, for he shall surely die.
And Jonathan answered Saul his father, and said unto him, Wherefore shall he be slain? what hath he done?
And Saul cast a javelin at him to smite him: whereby Jonathan knew that it was determined of his father to slay David.
So Jonathan arose from the table in fierce anger, and did eat no meat the second day of the month: for he was grieved for David, because his father had done him shame.
And it came to pass in the morning, that Jonathan went out \add into\add* the field at the time appointed with David, and a little lad with him.
And he said unto his lad, Run, find out now the arrows which I shoot. \add And\add* as the lad ran, he shot an arrow beyond him.
And when the lad was come to the place of the arrow which Jonathan had shot, Jonathan cried after the lad, and said, \add Is\add* not the arrow beyond thee?
And Jonathan cried after the lad, Make speed, haste, stay not. And Jonathan’s lad gathered up the arrows, and came to his master.
But the lad knew not any thing: only Jonathan and David knew the matter.
And Jonathan gave his artillery unto his lad, and said unto him, Go, carry \add them to\add* the city.

\add And\add* as soon as the lad was gone, David arose out of \add a place\add* toward the south, and fell on his face to the ground, and bowed himself three times: and they kissed one another, and wept one with another, until David exceeded.

And Jonathan said to David, Go in peace, forasmuch as we have sworn both of us in the name of the \sc Lord\sc*, saying, The \sc Lord\sc* be between me and thee, and between my seed and thy seed for ever. And he arose and departed: and Jonathan went \add into\add* the city.
